definition: to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
brave man, willing to risk his life
to throw oneself at sb or sth/to bend over backwards to help

sentences.english: You don't have tol bust your ass all the time. 'cause life is going on.
sentences.chinese: 你不要總是那麼拼命，人生還很長，要慢慢來。

sentences.english: Why are you always such a hard-worker?
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼總是這麼拼命的工作？

sentences.english: On Wednesday, it was a sampler. She says the stripling's fun.
sentences.chinese: 一個星期三場音樂會真是有點拼命幹，對不對？

sentences.english: Miracles sometimes occur, but one has to work terribly for them. (C.Weizmann)
sentences.chinese: 奇蹟有時候是會發生的，但是你得爲之拼命的努力。

sentences.english: He sweats himself to earn as much money as possible.
sentences.chinese: 他拼命幹活以掙得儘可能多的錢。

sentences.english: At this, he instantly let me go, and I ran for my life.
sentences.chinese: 聽到這話，他立刻放開了我，我於是拼命逃跑。

sentences.english: Ganymede tried to recollect that it was a man's duty to comfort and console a woman, the weaker vessel.
sentences.chinese: 蓋尼末德又拼命記起男人有責任安慰勸解女人。

sentences.english: Small effect, I always did desperately want to escape bathtub.
sentences.chinese: 對小起，我總是那樣拼命地想逃出洗澡盆。

sentences.english: So the combat went hand to hand, both men clawing for every last vote.
sentences.chinese: 因此戰爭繼續，每個人都在爲最後的選票拼命。

sentences.english: You ought not to work so hard.
sentences.chinese: 你不應該這麼拼命工作。

sentences.english: He's been working his butt off since he started last fall.
sentences.chinese: 自從他去年秋天到職以來就一直很拼命地工作。

sentences.english: Didn't you see he was trying to cut right in front of us?
sentences.chinese: 你沒看到他在拼命往我們前面衝過來嗎？

sentences.english: She muscled through the throngs of people, frantically searching for David.
sentences.chinese: 她使勁擠過人羣，拼命尋找戴維。

sentences.english: He cut desperately at the rope in an attempt to free his foot.
sentences.chinese: 他拼命砍繩子，試圖把自己的腳解脫開。

sentences.english: If the memory had a delete button, they would be jabbing it hard.
sentences.chinese: 如果記憶也有一個消除鍵，他們一定會拼命拼命地按。

definition: reckless/regardless of everything
one's utmost/(to fight or work) desperately hard/to put up a life or death struggle/at all costs
to do everything one can/to spare no effort/to strive
to work hard/to do one's very best/to throw oneself into the task at hand
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
strenuously/persistently/hard/painful
to strive one's hardest/to spare no effort
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to struggle
incessant
to do one's utmost
crazy/frantic/extreme popularity
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
great effort/to strive/to try hard
to make a supreme effort/at all costs
